definition: Classic of Rites
gift/rite/ceremony/CL:份[fen4]/propriety/etiquette/courtesy
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

sentences.english: Confucius said, food and sex are basic human desires.
sentences.chinese: 孔子曾在《禮記》裏說到飲食男女，人之大欲存焉。

sentences.english: Lijizhiyi is a academic works of Guo Songtao who was a scholar in Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 《禮記質疑》是清代學者郭嵩燾撰寫的一部學術著作。

sentences.english: Book of Rites is a works that emphasizes particularly on interpreting action and meaning of propriety in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 《禮記》一書側重於闡明中國古代禮儀的作用和意義。

definition: Zheng Xuan (127-200), late Han scholar
Rites and Ceremonies, part of the Confucian Classic of Rites 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4]
Xiaojing (Classic of Filial Piety)

lit. “Mr. Lü's Spring and Autumn (Annals)”, compendium of the philosophies of the Hundred Schools of Thought 諸子百家|诸子百家[zhu1 zi3 bai3 jia1], compiled around 239 BC under the patronage of Qin Dynasty 秦代[Qin2 dai4] Chancellor Lü Buwei 呂不韋|吕不韦[Lu:3 Bu4 wei2]
Kong Yingda (574-648), Confucian scholar
History of the Former Han Dynasty, second of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Ban Gu 班固[Ban1 Gu4] in 82 during Eastern Han (later Han), 100 scrolls
the Rites of Zhou (in Confucianism)
"Erya" or "The Ready Guide", first extant Chinese dictionary, c. 3rd century BC, with glossaries on classical texts
Zuo Zhuan or Tsochuan, Mr Zuo's Annals or Mr Zuo's commentary on 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], early history c. 400 BC attributed to famous blind historian Zuo Qiuming 左丘明[Zuo3 Qiu1 ming2]
commentary and subcommentary (of a book)
Mr Gongyang's Annals or commentary on 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], early history, probably written by multiple authors during Han dynasty, same as 公羊春秋[Gong1 yang2 Chun1 qiu1]
Records of the Grand Historian, by 司馬遷|司马迁[Si1 ma3 Qian1], first of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3]
to check and correct
Yi Zhuan, commentary on the "Book of Changes" or "I Ching" 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1]
The School Sayings of Confucius (abbr. for 孔子家語|孔子家语[Kong3 zi3 Jia1 yu3])
sound and meaning
